Reviews.Title: “CAUTION: Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Supervisor52970
Reviews.Content: Yes, bedbugs. We observed bite marks AND a live adult-size bedbug. Deadbolt lock was pulled out of the door at the screws; old fashioned metal room key-- no electronic cardkeys; room door did not meet the casing or threshold; television cable dangling mid-air, not properly attached to any surface; no television remote; only 4 t.v. channels; radiant heat noisy; room was way too hot; our colleague's room was drafty and cold; the community bathroom was clean, but the rest of the hotel was not; bathroom door lock was very difficult to operate; beds were sunken in the middle; no chair in bedroom; no place to set suitcase

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: ashley r
Reviews.Content: I urge you not to waste your time and money on this place. I went to NYC for my birthday for a few days. On the last day of our stay, I personally found 3 cockroaches in the bathroom. I was utterly disgusted. We went to talk to the staff and they said they would need to check it out themselves. I am convinced that during that time they killed the cockroaches themselves and got rid of the evidence. I even called them on it but of course they denied it. Unfortunately we forgot to take a picture of the cockroaches so essentially, it was our word against theirs and there was nothing we could do. After I began to cry because this incident occurred ON my birthday and I was so upset, they FINALLY offered a discount of 50 %- too low if you ask me. We immediately left and stayed at another hotel for our last night. Dont waste your time on this dirty overpriced place !

Reviews.Title: “a joke.”
Reviews.Author: donna c
Reviews.Content: the only review i would give of this total dump is to warn anyone thinking of staying there to GO ELSEWHERE....and the guy on the reception who likes to throw his rubbish and aim it at the bin on the other side of the room whilst talking to you...says it all really...oh not forgetting the down and outs who stay there..no disrespect to people who are on social security but it was bloody awful....there was a problem with my booking so i went elsewhere ....i wouldnt have stayed there anyway....i have complained to my travel agent about it....the only reason i gave it a rating was so i could post this review....

Reviews.Title: “Ignore reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tracey R
Reviews.Content: I am a teacher myself and 2 colleauges took 17 students to New York we have just returned and have to say felt unsure before our visit to the hostel afer reading the reviews. This hostel was far better than we have previously experienced ,the bedding-was so clean and smelt lovely ,the bathrooms which I am funny about was clean and toilet tissue always available. The staff were always helpful and gave us advice as needed ,my only ctitiscm was they need an area for groups to sit and chill at the end of the day (maybe the end of each floor ,there is definitely space we're the bins are situated at present ). Please try this hostel and then judge fairly

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: ceri_AUS
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree that the pictures and desciption on the web are very misleading. Not at all what we were expecting. Our room was so small that you could barely walk around the double bed, and we couldnt even open the wardrobe door fully as the bed was in the way and there was no room for our stuff. The place is quite old and run down but also not clean, the bathrooms are pretty poor. The location is good, near the subway, quiet area and a few nice places to eat. Only stay in the cheap rooms if your spending all your time out and only sleeping there as we did, couldnt have put up with it otherwise. I dont have a problem with getting what you pay for but I do take issue with the way the rooms were misrepresented.

Reviews.Title: “what the hell”
Reviews.Author: Dawit D
Reviews.Content: This so called hotel was one of the worst places i have ever rested my head. WIth stains on the sheets and a television with only four different channels there is no need for a remote because there will not be one in your room. Also they do not tell us about the noises our heating system makes. honestly the only good thing about this hotel better hostel is the surrounding, it is very nice and safe. The rooms are as big as my closet at home. There is also a great view of the brick building next door. Heat cuts off after 12am.Another great aspect is that u get to share a restroom with at least six other rooms. But they do have wifi that you have to login to every five minutes. So if you are reading this and have booked your reservation to stay at this wonderful facility you should know that you are screwed because they have a three day process to cancel your room and also do not have a phone to contact them. So i hope you enjoy your stay at the royal park hotel of f hell.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location, good staff, really old building”
Reviews.Author: Bella2309
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a whole week during new years holiday, the location was great, only two blocks from the red subway and 5 min to times square, once you enter the building you notice why it was soo cheap, the building is really old, the carpets in the hallsway, the front desk everything smells weird, once you are in the room it does not look like the one in the photo, but to be honest, it was clean the bathroom was completly refurbished and clean. mhy advice is bring your own towels, the ones they put are torn and have holes some of them even and have logo, brands on them, like if they were souvenirs from a gym o a race. If you are planning to be out all day and just come to sleep I I would totally recomend it, and I could come back. on the last day I got a chance to view another room with two beds, this room was completly new and look good, hopefully all rooms will be renew for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: The rooms you see in the pictures are not what you will get at all. If you're a budget backpacker, this place is for you. If you are looking for a quaint but quality to room for $100, go to the Holiday Inn on 57th. Arrived and was put in the wrong room which was dirty and had construction worker tools all over the floor, when I told front desk they informed me that the website was wrong (um, not my problem). Moved me to the correct room which did not have the glass shower you see in the pictures (it doesn't exist in that building). Then I found out the outlets didn't work in the room either. Fed up I wanted to leave but was worried about being charged for the 1st night due to the cancellation policy. Spoke to front desk and told them that what is advertised online is not the service provided to guests upon arrival and front desk person AGREED WITH ME. I asked if I would be charged if I left and he said NO. Only to find out 2 days later that they did charge me. Disputed the charges with management and they have only refunded half of my money. This place is garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CPlanner2224
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here last weekend for a weekend getaway. The room was clean, a corner unit and right next to the bathroom. We never had to wait to use the bathroom - which was also clean. The check-in and check-out process was quick. The hotel is in a good area (safe to walk to at night) and easy to get to since its a 2 minute walk to the 3 line on the subway. There is also a Walgreens at the corner and a good variety of restaurants nearby.The only thing that I would recommend in the room is to have a mirror in the room (we were a group of girls and it would prevent from going back and forth from the bathroom when getting ready) and more outlets in the room. There was only one power strip in the room and the TV was plugged into one of the outlets. We had to charge our phones and Ipods. We plan a trip to NYC every year and it's hard to find a cheap hotel in NYC- now that we found this place I would definitely book here again for future trips. This hotel is good for people who are planning to stay in NYC for 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff, cheap prices.”
Reviews.Author: Senada K
Reviews.Content: After a long road trip to NYC, we were very eager to check into our hotel. There was slight confusion upon check in, it was shortly resolved and we got the keys to our first floor 2 queen bed ensuite. It was newly remodeled, and everything was clean. The loud noise in the lobby durning the early evening was the only downfall, other than that we have no complaints. The desk clerk at night was very helpful with finding local bars for us to visit, and even gave us line passes into Webster Hall. The entire staff was friendly, and very accommodating. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “For budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: CAM1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part hotel, part hostel which makes it quite noisy at night as young people are arriving, using bathrooms and walking on the floors. Try to book a hotel room as they are renovated and offer amenities like an ensuite bathroom. Also, the location is good on the one hand (next to Broadway, 2min walk to Subway #19, lots of restaurants/fast food chains/shops close by), but VERY NOISY - traffic is heavy 24/7, a bus stops in front of the hotel and there is a parking garage next to the hotel. So, if you just want to sleep at the hotel (and are not a light sleeper), it's perfect for a short city trip - good value for money. No breakfast services offered. Don't go there in winter - the rooms are COLD! In summer, it should be fine - there is air condition in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean beds, great price, great staff”
Reviews.Author: alice_kim
Reviews.Content: As a student, I've stayed in a LOT of cheap hotels and hostels in the States, Europe, and Israel. When booking our stay at this place, we were hesitant but first and foremost, we were content with the location and the price of the room. When we arrived, the staff were young and super helpful during our stay, they offered to hold our bags for us on the day we arrived because we arrived 4 hours before check-in time. Our room was actually big for a New York hostel at this price. Plenty of room, and plus, who needs a big room in a big city like NYC? The beds were comfortable and clean for a hostel (or a cheap hotel, I guess). And housekeeping came every morning at 11am to offer to clean the room or just change the towels. The ensuite bathroom was a little small and the toilet didn't flush easily, BUT there were more public bathrooms on each floor. The location was the best part--safe, accessible, and right by the subway. And the front desk staff, again, were really cool and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and will rebook the next time I'm in New York! P.S. There is free wifi but apparently not in our room? We were on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: MEvNau
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and I stayed at the Royal Park Hotel. It was not fancy or plus. It could have used some patch work in the bathroom and some sprucing up. However, it was quiet and I felt very safe. The location to the subway was fantastic. We had no problems checking in, we got the room we booked and we were able to leave our bags the day of check out until we were ready to leave. The staff was not overly friendly but they were able to answer any questions I had. I think you get exactly what you pay for with this hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “hostel/hotel mix”
Reviews.Author: Mllecoccinelle
Reviews.Content: We went to NY early in October 2011. Royal Park hotel is not an hotel and is not an hostel. This place is a mix of them. Is better than an hostel but not enough great to be qualified as an hotel.... Anyway, staff is nice, you can leave your luggage for free at your arrival but you have to pay 2 $ per luggage to put your luggage at the reception at your departure (business is business) The elevator is probably the most slow of the world, but it works. The free WIFI is cool, but does not work in rooms (at the fourth floor, it does not work). So you have to go downstairs, to have it. I've booked a room with twin beds, in the end I had a bunkbed room. Not bad, but it's definetly NOT as the picture on the hotel's website (look the picture of the twin shared bathroom, and imagine everything except that) Rooms are small but clean and you have a small TV. Mattress, pillow, sheets and towels are also clean. Shared bathroom: 2 bathrooms per floor, probably not enough for the number of guest. Bathrooms are clean. The location is a good point. Central Park is very close by walk and the subway is just near the hotel (one street below). Upper West Side is a great neighborhood, and you have lot of shops and restaurants near the hotel. This hostel/hotel mix is clean and the location is really great. Maybe, this place is better for young people (don't expect hotel amenties here) But, for Manhattan, a clean private room for 2 under 150$ per night is just so rare! (except if you rent an apartment) If you think that is really stupid to pay 300$ per night for just a room and if you want to be in Manhattan with great location, Royal park hotel could be a good place for you..

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying here ever again”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_AAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this "hotel" for my first ever trip to New York, and although I loved New York I did not love this hotel. When we arrived there was a stuff up with the room we booked, apparently the heating was not working in the room we had booked. So we were given a room with a shared bathroom which is not what I had paid for. I had booked a room with a private bathroom the room with the shared bathroom was freezing and we had to wear our clothes to bed (first time I've ever worn a beanie to bed) and to go to the bathroom during the night my boyfriend said to wake him so I would not go alone. The next day we were moved to our "booked" room with a private bathroom. The Bathroom right off the bat was filthy, scum all around the shower and sink I had to stand on a plastic bag to shower as I did not have any thongs (flip slops) with me as it was winter and snowing when we visited New York. The new room was also freezing and we had to stuff a towel around the air conditioner as we had cold air blowing in. The maid service that brought towels and changed the bed linen would come around and even though we requested privacy and told her we did not need new linen the maid would open the door whilst we were mid getting dressed! I felt unsafe staying at this hotel as the lock on the door was very flimsy, but because we had already paid to stay there my boyfriend talked me into staying and he slept on the side closest to the door. Not to mention the elevator was ancient. I would never stay here again the price for this place is ridiculous for what you get. Oh and one day when we arrived back to the room the wall was painted blue...

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel. It is a hostel. It is perfect for a cheap room in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lennywithay
Reviews.Content: We had a run in with the manager over a leak in the roof. She was rude, patronising and unhelpful. Other than that the atay was fine we were a group of friends looking for cheap accommodation in ny and this suited us. Good location but dont expect anything fancy. It shouldn't be classifed as a hotel. There is no communal eating area/kitchen so no where to leave food. Other than thhat, clean towels, nice staff and WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “worst place i ever been”
Reviews.Author: lacapuzz
Reviews.Content: I have been in real hostels, even rome's 10euros per nite shared rooms are more comfy than this, this thing is not comparable to a hostel .... i am havin problems breathin for the room is the filthiest thing i've ever seen in my life, and i'm all bout a perfect householder. when i arrived i didn't even realize that they didn change the rubbish bag before givin me the room, i wish they had at least changed the towels and the sheets in the beds, and u cant bet i didn even open the beds once.. I WAS CHARGED 100 BUCKS PER NITE IN THIS S//////!!!!!!TTY PLACE. complaining wont help for they're gonna put u in another ugly room, it's july n its all fully booked..... just don't book, tell ur friends not to book and run away if they give u the h33 key at the check in. wth. i wanna cry. thx god im leaving in 2 days

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good for budget”
Reviews.Author: VLF1601
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times. What I like about it is that it has good value for money. The location is really good, not that far from times square, only two blocks from the subway station, and lots of stores all around: you can find everything you need within a 5 minutes walk. Other than that, due to my several stays there, I got the opportunity to stay in several different rooms, and all I can say is that all of them where different, so different: double double, twin, bunk beds, etc. Some are more modern, bigger, with a better view. I guess you can really enjoy your stay if you are lucky enough to get one of their nice room; I personnally asked only once to get a new room because I was unhappy with the one I had been given, and they did gave me a new one. I will probably go there again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Basic, Basic”
Reviews.Author: Alteex
Reviews.Content: My title says it all! I would not recommend a stay here for the following reasons: - For 4 nights we were charged $441. However, this does not include the mysterious 'Hotel' taxing system that many hotels and hostels impose in NYC. So it ended up being over $500. Now, read on and you'll see why the hostel wasn't worth it. - The first room given to us consisted of two bunk beds which you could not swing a cat in despite me ordering two single beds this was very disappointing. - The water system in the building is very old and we were subjected to a loud knocking noise from the water tank system all night! I barely got any sleep on the first night which made the day even more tiring given the level of sight seeing we undertook. We ended up not going out in the evening because of this. - Many of the shower/toilet rooms are cold and damp with very basic facilities. You end up hunting down the better showers down throughout the building as most are old showers being drippy. We were moved on the second night to a better room and were eventually given what we had ordered. On a lighter note, the rooms came with air con, heating and a TV with amazingly irrelevant and dare I say it. 'basic' channels. If you don't mind no thrills for your stay or are on an extremely tight budget I would say consider this. Nevertheless, the hostel is in my opinion overpriced which begs the question that there must have been better for our 500 bucks in such a big city. I would say look around before your are subjected to it!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Park - Hostel World”
Reviews.Author: LKraf
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recomend Royal Park Hotel and Hostel World booking website. We made a reservation and payed 45 days in advance. 6 days before our arrival, we received an email telling us that our reservation would not be honoured. That is absolutely outrageous! In 6 days everything is full in NYC, we ended up having to chose between a terrible and old hotel or a very, very expensive one. This really spoilled our hoiday, YOU CANNOT TRUST HOSTEL WORLD an ROYAL PARK HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: beachlove111
Reviews.Content: I dont know what everyones complaining about.. we loved this place. We were in a double double ensuite room. The location could not be better, the staff were awesome, the room was fresh and clean and the price was great. Sure, we would have loved a fridge and coffee making facilities in the room, and yes the bathroom is small. but this is new york and you get what you pay for. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: anyquestionz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay - but nothing more than that. There's one really good room we could have for the first night (a suite or something) which was really nice and well equipped. What we got after that was, well.. Something I never got before: Small bath room, uneven ground in the sleeping room, a door that couldn't be securely locked, wifi only in the lobby.. But since we had such a good time we didn't care, but otherwise.. :/ not to be recommende if you want to feel any kind like at home.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell0804
Reviews.Content: The Royal Park Hotel is a nightmare, I mean if you are going to charge people $60.00 a night for a room at least give them a half-way decent, clean, comfortable room. I came by the Hotel to check it out before I book a room. I was shown a model room, I should of known better. I checked in on January 9, 2011 for two nights. I arrive early I was told I had to wait for two hours before a room is ready. When I got checked in and paid I got a key to a room. The room was very tiny there was no closet, and it was freezing cold. I came downstairs and asked to be moved. I was given another room that was not even half-way decent. It was filty the TV did not work, and the bed was so low to the floor. The electricity kept going off I was without electricty and cold. They did not offer any options or anything instead the front desk asct as if this was the first time someone has ever complained about their Hotel. There are people who are living there that are crack addicts, perverts, and convicts. The Royal Park was a half way house before it became a hotel. I know that some people on here have posted some comments coveying that the Royal Park was a nice, clean, place to them I say you must either live just like that, becasue if you think that the Royal Park Hotel is a great place then you do not value who you are or what you consider acceptable accommodations. The other dilemma I had was that there was no wireless of course there is no wireless its because they have convicts living in the buildings and they cannot havd access to e-mails. I have stayed at several Hostels in New York this by far was the worse one ever. It's a dump I would rather pay more money for a half way decent, clean, comfortable room because I value where I put my head to rest at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “It is a HOSTEL”
Reviews.Author: Janice81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Royal Park for 4 nights over the Christmas period. If you are expecting this hostel to be anything above 'hostel quality' then you will be disappointed. We were not expecting much from this hostel and so we weren't disappointed. However, before NYC, we travelled around and stayed in actual, decent hotels and we found that a hostel was not something for us. The main negative point I found about this hostel was the smell. As soon as you walk in, the smell hits you. The hostel itself appears pretty old and run down. The reception or customer service we got was average. We stayed in a private room with ensuite which was extremely tiny but I suppose that's expected in NYC. The room itself was reasonably clean. The positive thing about this hostel was its location close to the 96th st subway station which was only a 2 min walk away. If you've stayed in hostels before and are not expecting anything at a hotel level, then go fot it (also if you can stand weird smells). If not, stick to a hotel. After we stayed out our 4 night booking, we moved to a hotel. Hostels aren't for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “ILLEGAL HOTEL, TENANTS THROWN ON THE STREET! DO NOT GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: Nag72
Reviews.Content: This is an illegal hotel as this place is actually a single room occupancy (SRO) building for permanent residents who are mostly poor people (rent: $200-$500/month). The owner of the building has been using emptying tactics (such as cutting the gas supply, threats of eviction, renting rooms to persons out of jail or mental hospital which led to shady stories and by that I mean the worstâ€¦) so that those permanent residents leave the building (they often end up homelessâ€¦) in order to use it as an hotel and make a greater profit than they can from the low-income tenants (30 times the rent per room depending on the room as we were paying $200/night). I know that because I met one the few tenants left in that building after an incident involving a huge cockroach who told me all about her 20-year-struggle to keep her room. I felt pretty bad participating in that evil plan to put poor people on the streets so that a greedy and cold-blooded landlord makes big bucks. This building is also unsanitary as there should be one person per room, but as they put as many tourists as they can in each room the shared bathroom is beyond filthy (not mention the staff is not really good at cleaning, if they actually cleanâ€¦). It also constitutes a real disturbance for the tenants whose privacy is invaded and lifestyle disturb by the constant presence of tourists. My friends and I had a room with a private bathroom (which was still not very cleanâ€¦). There were stains on our sheets (changed every 3 days) and on the towels. We also had cockroaches in our bedroom (I even found one on my bedâ€¦). There could also be fire and security hazards anytime as the outlets are not properly sealed to the wall and as itâ€™s a SRO building, it doesnâ€™t comply with the fire code for commercial hotels. The paint on the wall was peeling off (and they never vacuumed it). I am also posting some pictures so that you can see the room. The staff is also very unhelpful and kind of shady and we could not trust them at all to resolve any kind of issues. It seemed you have to fight with them to get things done, and of course, whatever the problem is, they will never apologize. Undeniably the poorest customer service I have ever experienced. One of my friends lost her mobile phone in the lobby. When she asked the receptionist for it, he said they found it and that she will get it back. But then, they never gave it back to her because they â€œapparentlyâ€� gave it to someone else. Go figure it outâ€¦ One night, we could not take it anymore (the night I found the cockroach on my bed) so we argued with the receptionist until almost 1 a.m. to be moved to a decent hotel. Again, we ended up in illegal hotels owned by the same person who has 4 other buildings (we stayed at Marrakech hotel and Portland Square hotel). We found hair in the bathroom and stains on the sheets but overall it was better and cleaner, and we made sure we wouldn't have to pay for it. I still felt really bad to stay again in an illegal hotel but as we paid ahead we could not do anything about it. This is the short version of the story, but it was my first time in NYC, and Royal Park Hotel ruined a big part of my trip. This practice seems to be really common in NYC and a bill to put an end to illegal was passed last summer. Hotels in NYC are really expensive and next time I will go there I will rent a room or an apartment from New-Yorkers. There are plenty of ads on http://newyork.craigslist.org/vac/. I know some people say they had a good experience because they have renovated a couple of floors. But that's no excuse to book a room there. This is still an ILLEGAL HOTEL and TENANTS ARE THROWN ON THE STREET!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation on Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: bedrin
Reviews.Content: Location is very good and the prices are very low for Manhattan. However do not expect much from this hostel. Rooms are pretty small but it's ok if you go to the hotel only for sleeping. There's a ceiling fan, but no AC, so it might be hot in summer. Bathrooms aren't very clean; no kitchen available. Free Wi-Fi is available only in lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!!! Very friendly personnel!!!Great location”
Reviews.Author: waynewilkinson
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a swanky hotel room the Royal Park is not for you but if you want a reasonably priced room which is clean and in a very convenient location (i.e. if you want to save your spending money for other things other than a hotel room) this hotel would probably work for you...A friend of mine and I stayed here for the New York marathon..yes, I was worried about bed bugs,etc since the price was so low but, fortunately, my worries were unfounded...We stayed in the room directly off the "lobby".It was very large especially by new york standards with 2 ddble beds, clean, nice shower but no tub, no phone (but with cell phones who needs one), no fridge or microwave but excellent and friendly personnel who were a pleasure to have around..I was worried about noise during the night since we were right off the lobby and on the street but it was quiet and the bed was comfortable...a non pretentious, practical place to stay...save your money for shopping!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop moaning and spend more money if you want five star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 32655Happytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights over the weekend of the marathon and the place was booked up.I was in a double room that was old but clean comfortable and warm, Ok the room was only small but what do you expect in New York, My floor had two spotless bathrooms that I had no problem getting into when I needed to. My room was cleaned and I was given clean towels daily. The subway is two minutes walk away and only $2.25 per trip, Taxi ride to any part of Manhattan was no more than $17 even at prak times, Would I stay again? YES!! Would I recommend? YES If you want more cash to spend on the important things to do in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: claire9386
Reviews.Content: After looking for a hotel in NYC and after seeing the prices we decided to book this place but then when I seen all the reviews I was slightly scared of staying there but what a surprise! Arrived late at night to very friendly staff the room we were in was a twin room with a double bed and single bed with a sink in the room and right next to the bathroom. The rooms and bathroom were all clean and not at all like other reviews. The cleaners were at the hotel the whole day and we never had a problem at all. The location is brilliant - one block to 96th street station, safe place with amenties all close by. Would recommend again and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent low-budget hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mack16
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap but clean hotel in New York: this is it!!! We stayed in a private room with a double bed. The shared bathroom was just outside our room. Both the room as the bath room were old but nice, and most important: clean. Staff was friendly. Subway and local shops are just around the corner so perfect! We will definitely stay here again when we're in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL !! NO IDEA WHY THESE PEOPLE ARE COMPLAINING !!!”
Reviews.Author: Beautiful_pd
Reviews.Content: Honestly, we went there with a large group , had a room on the 6th floor as well as the 7th. And it was amazing, good rates, good service. A couple of the bathrooms arent so nice, but theres two on each floor. And where u share them obviously u should wear flip flops . Its a great location, the staff was also very helpful ! !

Reviews.Title: “I am confused till now.....but whatever.”
Reviews.Author: ann1504
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got the keys from our rooms, we checked the rooms and I was really looking for bed gugs because of many reviews about that.. but did not find any. so we agreed to stay... I suggest to check the room more propperly before paying for it! after we payed, we got to room. then I found some other people clothes fallen behind the heatings, the aircondition was not working so good, the room was so small ( in the room I was with my boyfriend), we did not have enough space for all our stuff and when I imagined that I am going for shopping there... where should I put all that staff? There was a little space like warderobe , but with 2 hangers only! The other room of my friend was a little bigger I can say. Regarding the shower and restroom, it was not so bad, actually clean all day, but I would never step there without a flip-flops :) But what really made me confused and angry till now is that even we had privacy sign on the door, the housekeeping service entered the room! That time we were not inside, but I could recognize that they were there cause the bed was made. But exuse me, if I require a privacy by hanging the sign on the door.... this was too much. This hostel has EXCELLENT location for 100%, the subway station is really close!!

Reviews.Title: “T E R R I B L E !!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPlus
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dirty, old, never cleaned and totally different from the pictures you can see on their website. Bathroom is disgusting, rooms are very small, dirty and they never change sheets. There is no telephone, phon, bedside table, I travel a lot, but I would never imagine that such a kind of "hotel" could exist!!!! S T A Y A W A Y

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i've ever stayed at in my life. Horrible”
Reviews.Author: samiautomatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be decent...in a third world country. First off, it was way over priced for one full sized bed. The room was dirty and had a cement floor with a very thin carpet. The art work was on the floor beside a mirror which was also on the floor. No soap or towels in the bathroom, no soap or towels in the bedroom. On the 2nd day of us being there, we arrived and the staff had stuffed another full sized bed in the room. We asked them to take it out since room was clearly too small for two beds. They replied they would remove it and never did. In addition, no drinking water or beverage dispenser. Finally, room service didn't knock on the door before entering.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget vacation - private bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: WingDrill
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights in New York at the Royal Park Hotel & Hostel (RPH), and it was really quite good, and much better than expected. Unfortunately, on the first night there was some problem with one of the rooms and they got us a stay at a nearby hotel (higher quality, no extra) - only thing we were unhappy was the fact that we had to walk (not much, three blocks, but with bags it wasn't cheerful). We actually ended up thinking we should just stay at this other Hotel for the rest of the days, but eventually we didn't - and we're glad we haven't! Although the RPH lobby isn't the most attractive venue in town, and it could use some renovation, the room we were given was absolutely brilliant, fully renovated and with impeccable taste. The bathroom was (NY-standard) just huge, and the walk-in shower, besides being very big was also quite good. Bed was big enough, we had a closet with enough room for a lot of bags/luggage, and the bare-brick wall was just pitoresque. Sound-proofing was good (never any issue with noise or not being able to sleep), but it could be warmer (heaters available in the reception). The staff was young and helpful, and really went beyond their way to help. Definitely recommended - though, from what I saw, I wouldn't recommend the shared-bathroom rooms, unless you're sure they were renovated (they are slowly renovating the whole thing). Free Wi-Fi in the lobby. Save money on the hotel and stay here - and spend it where it counts in NY (there is no such thing as lack of things to do!!). Location - VERY good, right next to the subway, close to Central Park, and yet very, very quiet and relaxing. Cheap drycleaners everywhere, nice places to eat - really nice to be in "real" NY, and not jammed on tourist-traps... Would, most definitely, stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was too hot and too small but staff were great, had an amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: purplegirl21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a standard twin room with double beds at Royal Park for 7 nights with my good friend. In nut shell: small, basic, safe, clean, hot showers, friendly and helpful staff, right by subway, bargain price. Newly refurbished rooms look very posh, almost luxurious. Would stay there again. I personally rather spend more at the shops than on a room where I only sleep few hours and get ready for another amazing day in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “freezing cold, cheap and basic. dont go in the winter!”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes481
Reviews.Content: great location for metro, eating places, but dont call this accomadation a hotel, it is a hostel, clean and affordable , heating does'nt work that well , we had snow when we were there and it was so cold during the night we went to bed fully dressed and were still cold!! if you want basic and cheap this is your hostel, we had a double room with own bathroom, basic! clean! and cheap $845 7 nights about Â£530. hostel staff very nice and helpfull, pleasant and cheerfull. does get noisy if your on the ground floor, we were right by the door.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: ThatCitySort
Reviews.Content: I was there on a small budget so I saved a whole lot. I expected the room to be just a little bigger because the pictures on their site are taken at a very wide angle. There was construction going on so it smelled like paint. I guess it was wrong timing. The bathrooms didn't have handsoap! I had to go buy my own. I couldn't feel comfortable taking a shower in the communal bathroom but yes they do keep it decently clean for a hostel. They don't provide blankets and so it was pretty cold those two nights. But the only things keeping me satisfied about this hotel is that they had wifi available downstairs, I saved a lot of money, it was near a subway station and some great restaurants, and the front desk was open 24 hours. The staff's friendly and they do a great jobs with the rooms but like I said before, it's a sweet deal for a budgeted nyc trip.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for 75 dollars”
Reviews.Author: kibbabibba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and that was enough. Given the price ,75 dollars, for a double room, I had low expectations. The positives were the place was clean, the room was ready, and the staff was friendly. The negatives were the room was quite shabby and depressing looking. The shared bath was even more dilapidated. No way that I would use the shower. Given that one bathroom is shared by 16 people, it was looking pretty nasty by 9AM. Again, I didn't expect much but a mirror, hangers and a chair in the room, as well as an electric outlet in the bathroom would have been nice and worth an additional $10 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: lewieEastSussex
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Cold, dirty bathrooms, dirty rooms,dirty corridors. A constant smell in the corridor on 2nd floor !!! The staff were helpful as we had to move rooms 3 times to find an acceptable room. We did not have an en-suite room so had to share bathrooms....oh dear !!! Location of hotel was very good with the subway a very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathrooms and hallways just a few of the issues here...”
Reviews.Author: vikingwmn
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms are dirty and are not cleaned well on a daily basis. The same hair and q-tip was on the floor for three days! There is only internet on the first floor so there is always people in the hallway and the entrance is crowded. The Hallways are usually strewn with litter and need to be vacuumed. The rooms are ok but really little...

Reviews.Title: “A hostel, not a hotel - but for just a bed, perfectly fine.”
Reviews.Author: Legal_Eagle86
Reviews.Content: First things first, this is not a hotel - its a hostel. That might not be a problem for you, it wasn't for me, but it's good to be honest, no? The price of this place was so reasonable that it seems foolish to claim it was terrible, what do you expect for paying next to nothing? The rooms come with beds, plugs, drawers and that's about it. No TVs, no towel racks, no frills. On my list of priorities was Location, Security and Comfort. So how did it do? 1. Location - Hard to beat. Upper West Side is glorious and some of the bars around are some of the best in NYC (Cleopatra's Needle). The subway is a two minute walk and is on the express line, meaning your in Times Square very quickly. 2. Security - Not great. Our door had a lock that was, well, hard to lock. It didn't turn all the way and left a gap in the door. Not disastrous, but not great. Most worrying was the fact that around said lock, there was a crack that clearly indicated it has been kicked in at some point. The lock had simply been screwed back into the wood and perhaps most shockingly there was sticky tape around the cracks. Put simply - it was a concern for most of the trip. 3. Comfort - Fine, just fine. This category is perhaps more subjective, comfort for Paris Hilton is excessive for Joe Bloggs. However, the beds were good and the heating/cooling system, despite being too loud, worked. You get the BARE minimum, but if that's comfort for you, then it really is fine. Not a terrible place to stay for those wanting to do NYC on a shoe string. Would I go back? No, but only because of the security worries which you shouldn't be forced to deal with. The staff were lovely and helpful, the rooms cleaned daily and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly served its purpose, Very accessable”
Reviews.Author: Sargy-11
Reviews.Content: Ok lets be honest, you have booked a fantastic holiday to New York for Christmas and New Year, How much time do you really intend to spend in your hotel room? Well if your like me then thats the absolute minimum possible 1. for a shower and a change and 2. to get a little sleep (as you dont really want to miss any of the 24 hour city of New York do you). The Hotel is ideally located just off Broadway on West 97th street, the nearest subway is 1 street away on 96th and this gets you everywhere you need to be. Its 2 blocks away from Central park which is actually a nice walk (And walking is something you do alot of in New York). Our room was massive, and we also had a private bathroom, all kept very clean and tidy. No TV or Radio in the room, but what idiot wants to waste time watching TV and listening to radio in their room when they are in New York, certainly not me thats for sure. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. A couple a recomendations in the upper westside: Citrus restraunt, you have to check this place out stunning food at a reasonable price. Western Brewing Company (Its a pub) friendly staff and have a 2-4-1 happy hour!!!! massive food portions. To get to the Hotel get the airport train into Jamaica Street Station $5 each, buy a $2 subway ticket each then get the E Line (Blue) subway to 50th Street station (just after 7th avenue stop) the jump on the A Line (Blue) subway and get off at 96th you will then need to walk from their 2 blocks away to the west from central park and your there!!!!! BOOM $7 dollars each $56 less than a taxi and a hell of a lot quicker, which means $56 more to spend on the fantastic New York food and wine!!!!! If you have a fair bit of money check out Gordon Ramseys restraunt at the London hotel. Pricey but amazing!!!!!! Have a good time......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - if you don't care at all!”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentBubba
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room using the hotel's website. We chose ensuite with private bathroom. When we arrived, we were informed that no room with private bathroom was available for either of the nights we booked, so unless we wanted to look for a different hotel in NYC with our luggage that evening we had to accept that one with a small discount (about 10USD per night) for the shared bathroom! The room we were given was not even a shadow of the pictures you see on their website. It was quite dirty, had electricity wires unsafely coming out of the wall, there were pieces of wall on the hallway floor, the room smelled unpleasant, the door wouldn't close well from inside. Fortunately, the sheets and the towels were clean. The room was so tiny that the only things it contained were the bed and a little old piece of furniture with drawers! There was no table, no chairs, no other furniture, no bedside lamp, no TV, no phone, there wasn't even a place to hang our clothes and towels, so we had to put them on our luggage that would barely fit in the room as well. Usually they would change the towels and make the bed except for one night of our stay. The shared bathrooms were relatively clean; however, in the morning all of them were busy, meaning all bathrooms on each and every floor. So unless you are willing to wake up before others, you'll have to wait a lot for a free bathroom. One of the guys at the reception was very friendly and available whereas the other one we met was rude and unwilling to help, so it depends on the person. Finally, one evening when we came back to the hotel there was a NYPD team in the hall. We saw one of them talking to the receptionist and others taking pictures around. So it felt like being in a crime scene! Of course, this is to be considered a PLUS! ;) The price is a bargain for NYC, but honestly, had we known about the difference between what we thought we had reserved and what we eventually got, we would surely have considered booking with a different hotel. No doubt we'll go to a different hotel next time we're in NYC!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 258 West 97th Street, New York City, NY 10025
